conversations:
Are you kidding? I'm trained for nothing! I was laughed out of twelve
interviews today.
And yet you're surprisingly upbeat.

You would be too if you found John and David boots on sale, fifty
percent off!
Oh, how well you know me...
(walks up with a pot of coffee) Would anybody like more coffee?
Did you make it, or are you just serving it?
Absolutely.

Yeah, I think for us, kissing is pretty much like an opening act,
y'know? I mean it's like the stand-up comedian you have to sit through before Pink Floyd
comes out.

Yeah, and-and it's not that we don't like the comedian, it's that-that...
that's not why we bought the ticket.

The problem is, though, after the concert's over, no matter how great
the show was, you girls are always looking for the comedian again, y'know? I mean, we're
in the car, we're fighting traffic... basically just trying to stay awake.
Whose little ball of paper is this?!

Oh, uh, that would be mine. See, I wrote a note to myself, and then I
realised I didn't need it, so I balled it up and... (sees that Monica is glaring at him)
...now I wish I was dead.

Look , I'm sorry, guys, I just don't wanna give them any more ammunition
than they already have.

Yes, and we all know how cruel a parent can be about the flatness of a
child's pillow.

That's because as far as my parents are concerned, Ross can do no wrong.
Y'see, he's the Prince. Apparently they had some big ceremony before I was born.
(looking out the window) Ew, ew, ew, ew ew ew ew ew!
What?
Ugly Naked Guy got a Thighmaster!

I know I had it this morning, and I know I had it when I was in the
kitchen with...
...Dinah?
Oh, but look how straight those noodles are!

Now, Monica, you know that's not how you look for an engagement ring
in a lasagne...
(puts down the lasagne) I just... can't do it.
Boys? We're going in.

Yeah. Do that for another two hours, you might be where I am right about
now. (He enters.)
Kinda puts that whole pillow thing in perspective, huh, Mon?
What does she mean by 'involved'?
I mean presumably, the biggest part of your job is done.
Yeah. We don't speak. She's like this high-powered, driven career type.
What does she do?
Chandler, you're an only child, right? You don't have any of this.

Well, no, although I did have an imaginary friend, who... my parents
actually preferred.
What are we supposed to be seeing here?
I dunno, but.. I think it's about to attack the Enterprise.

Since always. It's like dating language. Y'know, like 'It's not you' means
'It is you'.

Or 'You're such a nice guy' means 'I'm gonna be dating leather-wearing
alcoholics and complaining about them to you'.
Yeah. Cushions the blow.

Yeah, it's like when you're a kid, and your parents put your dog to
sleep, and they tell you it went off to live on some farm.

"Warden, in five minutes my pain will be over. But you'll have to
live with the knowledge that you sent an honest man to die."
Hey, that was really good!
Thanks! Let's keep going.
Okay. "So. Whaddya want from me, Damone, huh?"

"I just wanna go back to my cell. 'Cause in my cell, I can
smoke."
"Smoke away."
What?
Relax your hand!
Whoah!
Hey!
Hey!
Alright, now try taking a puff.
No no no, I am not giving you a cigarette.
It's fine, it's fine. Look, do you wanna get this part, or not? Here.
Y'miss it?

Nah, not so much. Alright, now we smoke. (Takes a puff.) Oh.. my..
God. (He continues to smoke.)
- and there's five hundred extra dollars in my account.
Oh, Satan's minions at work again...
What is this?!
I'm smoking. I'm smoking, I'm smoking.
Oh, I can't believe you! You've been so good, for three years!
And this- is my reward!

Hold on a second, alright? Just think about what you went through the last
time you quit.
Okay, so this time I won't quit!
Ohhh! Put it out!

All right! I'm putting it out, I'm putting it out. (He drops it in
Phoebe's coffee.)
No. Not after what happened with Steve.

What are you talking about? We love Schhteve! Schhteve was schhexy!..
Sorry.
Really!

Oh, yeah. I'd marry him just for his David Hasselhof impression alone.
You know I'm gonna be doing that at parties, right? (Does the impression)
I mean, it-it was like, it was like he made us into a team.

Yep, we sure showed those Hassidic jewellers a thing or two about
softball..
Yeah, it's his, uh, innate Alan-ness that-that-that we adore.
I personally could have a gallon of Alan.

I know! I know, I opened it up and there it was, just floating in there,
like this tiny little hitch-hiker!
Well, maybe it's a contest, y'know? Like, collect all five?
It's worse than the thumb!
Hey, this is so unfair!
Oh, why is it unfair?

So I have a flaw! Big deal! Like Joey's constant knuckle-cracking
isn't annoying? And Ross, with his over-pronouncing every single word? And Monica, with
that snort when she laughs? I mean, what the hell is that thing? ...I accept all those
flaws, why can't you accept me for this?
Don't you realise what you're-you're doing to yourself?

Hey, y'know, I have had it with you guys and your cancer and your
emphysema and your heart disease. The bottom line is, smoking is cool, and you know it.

(holding the phone out to Chandler) Chandler? It's Alan, he wants to
speak to you.

Really? He does? (taking the phone) Hey, buddy, what's up! Oh, she
told you about that, huh. Well, yeah, I have one now and then. Well, yeah, now. Well, it's
not that big- ..well, that's true,.. Gee, y'know, no-one- no-one's ever put it like that
before. Well, okay, thanks! (He hands the phone back and stubs out his cigarette.)
(entering) Hey. Where's Joey?

Joey ate my last stick of gum, so I killed him. Do you think that was
wrong?
(finishing changing Chandler's nicotine patch) There y'go.
(deadpan) Ooh, I'm alive with pleasure now.
I'm sorry..
(sarcastic) Oh, she's sorry! I feel better!

You had a rough day, huh.. c'mere. (She sits down and Ross strokes her
forehead.)
...That's it. I'm getting cigarettes.
No no no!

(leaving) I don't care, I don't care! Game's over! I'm weak! I've
gotta smoke! I've gotta have the smoke!
Come on! You guys can pee standing up.
We can? All right, I'm tryin' that.
No plans, huh?
Not a one.
Not even, say, breaking up with Janice?
Oh, right, right, shut up.
Chandler, nobody likes breaking up with someone. You just gotta do it.

No, I know, but it's just so hard, you know? I mean, you're sitting
there with her, she has no idea what's happening, and then you finally get up the courage
to do it, and there's the horrible awkward moment when you've handed her the note.
You know, if you want, I'll do it with you.
Oh, thanks, but I think she'd feel like we're gangin' up on her.

Yeah, well, it's a Mercedes if I move back home. Oh, it was horrible. He
called me
Ooh, I hate when my father calls me that.

(on phone) Ok, bye. (hangs up) Well, Monica's not coming, it's just gonna
be me and Rachel.

Oh. Well, hold on camper, are you sure you've thought this thing
through?
It's laundry. The thinking through is minimal.

It's just you and Rachel, just the two of you? This is a date. You're
going on a date.
Nuh-uh.
Yuh-huh.
So what're you saying here? I should shave again, pick up some wine, what?

Well, you may wanna rethink the dirty underwear. This is basically the
first time she's gonna see your underwear—you want it to be dirty?
(sheepish) No.
Oh, and uh, the fabric softener?
This is nice. We never do anything just the two of us.

It's great. Maybe tomorrow we can rent a car and run over some
puppies.
Ok, have a good break-up.
Hey, Janice.

Oh, my god, I am so glad you called me. I had the most supremely awful
day.

Hey, that's not good. Can I get an espresso and a latte over here,
please?
What?
(covering) What... did you get me there?
I got you...these. (pulls out a pair of socks)
Bullwinkle socks. That's so sweet.

Well, I knew you had the Rockys, and so I figured, you know, you can
wear Bullwinkle and Bullwinkle, or you can wear Rocky and Rocky,or, you can mix and match,
moose and squirrel. Whatever you want.
That's great.
Yeah, it was really hard.
Oh, yeah, that hug looked pretty brutal.
Ow!
Oh, my god, I'm so sorry. Are you ok?

Oh my god. (Chandler downs another espresso.) How many of those have you
had?
Oh, I don't know, a million?
Chandler, easy, easy. Go to your happy place. La la la la la la la.
I'm fine.
It's like a gift.
We should always always break up together.

(reading the program) Ooh! Look! Look! Look! Look, there's Joey's
picture! This is so exciting!

You can always spot someone who's never seen one of his plays before.
Notice, no fear, no sense of impending doom...

Did anybody else feel they just wanted to peel the skin off their body,
to have something else to do?
(staring at a woman across the room) Ross, ten o'clock.
What?

(sighs and gestures to explain) There's a beautiful woman at eight,
nine, ten o'clock!
Oh. Hel-lo!

She's amazing! She makes the women that I dream about look like short,
fat, bald men!
Well, go over to her! She's not with anyone.

Oh yeah, and what would my opening line be? 'Excuse me.
Blarrglarrghh.'
He could never get a woman like that in a million years.
Thank you, buddy.
You could do that!
Y'think?
Yeah!

Oh God, I can't believe I'm even considering this... I'm very very
aware of my tongue...
C'mon! C'mon!
Here goes. (He walks over to her but just stands there.)
...Yes?

Hi.... um... okay, next word... would be... Chandler! Chandler is my
name, and, uh...(He clears his throat noisily)...hi.
Yes, you said that.

Yes, yes I did, but what I didn't say was what I was about to say,
what I wanted to say was, uh... would you like to go out with me sometime, thankyou,
goodnight. (He walks back to the others but she calls him back.)
(admitting) Saw your head. Saw your head.

(running back) She said yes!! She said yes!! (To Joey) Awful play,
man. Whoah. (To All) Her name's Aurora, and she's Italian, and she pronounces my name
'Chand-lrr'. 'Chand-lrr'. I think I like it better that way. (To Joey) Oh, listen, the
usher gave me this to give to you. (He fishes a card out of his pocket.)

(reading Monica's palm) No, 'cause this line is passion, and this is...
just a line.

Well, I can't believe I've been here almost seven seconds and you
haven't asked me how my date went.
Oh, right, right. How was your date, 'Chand-lrr'?

It was unbelievable. I-I've never met anyone like her. She's had the
most amazing life! She was in the Israeli army...

...Luckily none of the bullets hit the engine block. So, we made it
to the border, but just barely, and I- ...I've been talking about myself all night long,
I'm sorry. What about you? Tell me one of your stories.

Alright. Once I got on the subway, right, and it was at night, and I
rode it all the way to Brooklyn... just for the hell of it.
...All of a sudden we realised we were in Yammon.
Oh, I'm sorry, so 'we' is?
Who's Rick?
Who's Rick?
Ooooohhh.
Oh, so you're divorced?
No.
Oh, I'm sorry, then you're widowed?...Hopefully?
No, I'm still married.

So tell me, how do- how do you think your husband would feel about you

in my pocket?

Don't worry. I imagine he'd be okay with you because really, he's okay

Ethan? There's, there's an Ethan?
What?!

So explain something to me here, uh, what kind of a relationship do
you imagine us having if you already have a husband and a boyfriend?
I suppose mainly sexual.
Oh. I'm sorry it didn't work out.

What 'not work out'? I'm seeing her again on Thursday. Didn't you
listen to the story?
Tah-daaah!
Are we greeting each other this way now? 'Cause I like that.
(to Rachel) I can't believe you tried to move the green ottoman.

Thank God you didn't try to fan out the magazines. I mean, she'll
scratch your eyes right out.
Why would someone do that?! ...One might wonder.

Someone's left a glass on the coffee table. There's no coaster. It's a

closer to the surface of the wood...

C'mon, you guys. This is a real movie, and Al Pacino's in it, and that's

Oh no, it's terrific, it's... it's... y'know, you deserve this, after

He's in the bathroom. I don't think you wanna go in there!

C'mon, we're roommates! (He goes into the bathroom, screams, and runs

Who is being loud?

Oh, that would be Monica. Hey, listen, I wanna borrow a coupla things,

Oh, you got the whole night, huh?

Yeah, well, I only have twenty minutes until Ethan, so, y'know.. (He

Ooh, do I sense a little bit of resentment?

No, no resentment, believe me, it's worth it. 'Kay? Y'know in a

(He has armloads of stuff.)
Thank you.

No, actually I meant my fingers. Look at 'em, look at how happy they
are.

(moves Chandler's arm and look at his watch.) Oh my God, I'm late. (She

Oh no nonononononnononono, don't go.. (He kisses her and pulls her

Okay.
Don't go.
Okay. Oh no, I have to.
(to himself) Too bad, she's leaving.
(getting up and dressing) I'm sorry. He'll be waiting for me.
Well, I thought- I thought you talked to Rick.
It's not Rick.
What, Ethan? He got to spend the whole day with you!
No, it's-it's Andrew.

I know there'll be many moments in the years to come when I'll regret
asking the following question, but- And Andrew is?
He's... new.

Oh, so what you're saying is you're not completely fulfilled by Rick,
Ethan and myself?
No, that's not exactly what I was..
Well, y'know, most women would kill for three guys like us.
So what do you want?
You.
You have me!
Nono, just you.
Whaddyou mean?
Lose the other guys.
...Like, ...all of them?
C'mon, we're great together, why not?

Why can't we just have what we have now? Why can't we just talk, and
laugh, and make love, without feeling obligated to one another... and up until tonight I
thought that's what you wanted too.

...Well, y'know, part of me wants that, but it's like I'm two guys,
y'know? I mean, one guy's going 'Shut up! This is great!' But there's this other guy.
Actually it's the same guy that wells up every time that Grinch's heart grows three sizes

Get out!'
So... which one of the two guys will you listen to?

I don't know, I-I have to listen to both of them, they don't exactly
let each other finish...
Which one?
...The second guy.
No? What happened, big guy?
(to Ross) "Big guy?"
My mom will.
Something so sweet and...disturbing about that.
(awkwardly) Would you like to call somebody? (offering phone)

Yeah, thanks.
(takes phone)
Hello?
Hey, it's me.
I have no idea what you just said.
(angry) Put Joey on the phone.

(to everyone) Oh my God! He's trapped in an ATM vestibule with Jill
Goodacre! (on phone) Chandler, listen. (says something intentionally garbled)
Yeah, like that thought never entered my mind.
Would you like some gum?
Um, is it sugarless?

My God, you're choking! (she runs over and gives him the Heimlich, the gum
flies from his mouth) That better?
(gasping) Yes... thank you. That was... that was....
Chandler, we've been here for an hour doing this! Now watch, it's easy.
OK.
Well, this has been fun.

Yes. Yes, thanks for letting me use your phone... and for saving my
life.

Question. You're not dating anybody, are you, because I met somebody

Ah, y'see, perfect might be a problem. Had you said 'co-dependent', or

Do you want a date Saturday?
Yes please.
Okay. He's cute, he's funny, he's-
He's a he?

Um... yeah. Well, I mean, when I first met you, y'know, I thought maybe,
possibly, you might be...
You did?

Yeah, but then you spent Phoebe's entire birthday party talking to my

Huh. Did, uh... any of the rest of you guys think that when you first

Nono, me neither. Although, uh, y'know, back in college, Susan Sallidor

You're kidding! Did you tell her I wasn't?
I dunno, 'cause you're smart, you're funny...
Ross is smart and funny, d'you ever think that about him?
Yeah! Right!
WHAT IS IT?!
Yes. Absolutely. A quality.

Oh, oh, a quality, good, because I was worried you guys were gonna be
vague about this.
Oh! Okay! Phew!
So, uh... what do you think it is about me?
I dunno, uh... you just have a-a...
...Quality, right, great.

Y'know, it's a shame, because you and Lowell would've made a great
couple.
Lowell? Financial Services' Lowell, that's who you saw me with?
What? He's cute!
Well, yeah... 's'no Brian in Payroll.
Is Brian...?

No! Uh, I d'know! The point is, if you were gonna set me up with
someone, I'd like to think you'd set me up with someone like him.
(entering with Chandler) Morning. We ready to go?

Well, don't we look nice all dressed up?...It's stuff like that, isn't
it?
What?
Nothing, just your overcoat sounds remarkably like Brent Mussberger.
Check it out, Giants-Cowboys. (He has a pocket TV)
You're watching a football game at a funeral?
No, it's the pre-game. I'm gonna watch it at the reception.
You are a frightening, frightening man.
Sorry- Hi, I'm Dorothy's daughter.
Hi, I'm Chandler, and I have no idea who Dorothy is.
...Chandler!
Hey.
Yes, yes, fine, that is my penis. Can we be grown-ups now?
Who are those people?
I know. That's what I told her.
Really.
Yeah.
So- you can tell?
Pretty much, most of the time. We have a kind of... radar.
So you don't think I have a, a quality?
Hey, hey.
Hey.
Hey.
And this from the cry-for-help department. Are you wearing makeup?
Yes, I am. As of today, I am officially Joey Tribbiani, actor slash model.

That's so funny, 'cause I was thinking you look more like Joey
Tribbiani, man slash woman.
You know, the asthma guy was really cute.
Do you know which one you're gonna be?
No, but I hear lyme disease is open, so... (crosses fingers)
Good luck, man. I hope you get it.

And I assume, Chandler, you are still boycotting all the pilgrim
holidays.
Yes, every single one of them.
Absolutely. Shoop, shoop, shoop. Only a hundred and two dollars to go.
I thought it was $98.50.

Oh, I believe it. I think the baby can totally hear everything. I can
show you. Look, this will seem a little weird, but you put your head inside this turkey,
and then we'll all talk, and you'll hear everything we say.

I'd just like to say that I'm totally behind this experiment. In fact,
I'd very much like to butter your head.

Wait, wait, Chandler, this is what you're havin' for Thanksgiving
dinner? What, what, what is it with you and this holiday?
All right, I'm nine years old.
Oh, I hate this story.

We just finished this magnificent Thanksgiving dinner. I have--and I
remember this part vividly--a mouthful of pumpkin pie, and this is the moment my parents
choose to tell me they're getting divorced.
Oh my god.

Yes. It's very difficult to appreciate a Thanksgiving dinner once
you've seen it in reverse.
Set another place for Thanksgiving. My entire family thinks I have VD.
Tonight, on a very special Blossom.

I got the tickets! I got the tickets! Five hours from now, shoop, shoop,
shoop.
Oh, you must stop shooping.
Chandler, will you just come in already?
No, I prefer to keep a safe distance from all this merriment.
Look out, incoming pumpkin pie!

Ok, we all laughed when you did it with the stuffing, but that's not
funny anymore.
I can't, I gotta go.

Come on. An 80-foot inflatable dog let loose over the city. How often
does that happen?
No, no, no, you said, "got the keys".
the keys?
Why do you guys have so many keys in there anyway?
(sarcastic) For an emergency just like this.

Why? Because everything is my responsibility? Isn't it enough that I'm
making Thanksgiving dinner for everyone? You know, everyone wants a different kind of

and, and I... I...

Ok, Monica, only dogs can hear you now, so, look, the door's open.
Here we go.
Stop it, stop it, stop it!
Now this feels like Thanksgiving.
By all means.
Ok, who wants light cheese, and who wants dark cheese?
The bigger half.

I'd like to propose a toast. Little toast here, ding ding. I know this
isn't the kind of Thanksgiving that all of you all planned, but for me, this has been
really great, you know, I think because it didn't involve divorce or projectile vomiting.
Anyway, I was just thinking, I mean, if you'd gone to Vail, and if you guys'd been with
your family, if you didn't have syphilis and stuff, we wouldn't be all together, you know?
So I guess what I'm trying to say is that I'm very thankful that all of your Thanksgivings
sucked.
And a crappy New Year.
Here, here!
That is so cruel! Why? Why would a parent name their child Bethel?
Hey, that monkey's got a Ross on its ass!

So you guys, I'm doing all new material tonight. I have twelve new songs
about my mother's suicide, and one about a snowman.
Might wanna open with the snowman.

Hey, do you guys know what you're doing for New Year's? (They all
protest and hit her with cushions) Gee, what?! What is wrong with New Year's?

Nothing for you, you have Paolo. You don't have to face the horrible
pressures of this holiday: desperate scramble to find anything with lips just so you can

Yeah, you wish!

It's just that I'm sick of being a victim of this Dick Clark holiday.
I say this year, no dates, we make a pact. Just the six of us- dinner.
Yeah, okay. Alright.
Y'know, I was hoping for a little more enthusiasm.

Well, c'mon, if it's important enough to discuss while I'm playing, then
I assume it's important enough for everyone else to hear!
(Quietly, to the others) That guy's going home with a note!

Well, he's kinda like the guy I went to see that with. Except, except
he-he's smarter, and gentler, and sweeter... I just- I just wanna be with him all the
time. Day and night, and night and day... and special occasions...

Wait a minute, wait a minute, I see where this is going, you're gonna

pact.
No, no, no, no, no, no. Yeah, could I just?
Yeah, 'cause I already asked Janice.
C'mon, this was a pact! This was your pact!
I snapped, okay? I couldn't handle the pressure and I snapped.
Yeah, but Janice? That-that was like the worst breakup in history!
I'm not saying it was a good idea, I'm saying I snapped!
Nice shoes, huh? (He wiggles his foot and the bells tinkle)
Aah, y'killing me!

I didn't wanna leave him alone. Alright? We- we had our first fight this
morning. I think it has to do with my working late. I said some things that I didn't mean,
and he- he threw some faeces...
Y'know, if you're gonna work late, I could look in on him for you.

Oh, that'd be great! Okay, but if you do, make sure it seems like you're
there to see him, okay, and you're not like doing it as a favour to me.
Okay, but if he asks, I'm not going to lie.

I'm sorry, okay. It's just that Chandler has somebody, and Phoebe has
somebody- I thought I'd ask Fun Bobby.
Fun Bobby? Your ex-boyfriend Fun Bobby?
You know more than one Fun Bobby?
I happen to know a Fun Bob.

Oh, it's-it's Marcel. He keeps shutting me out, y'know? He's walking
around all the time dragging his hands...
That's so weird, I had such a blast with him the other night.
Really.
Yeah, we played, we watched TV.. that juggling thing is amazing.
What, uh... what juggling thing?
With the balled-up socks? I figured you taught him that.
No.

Y'know, it wasn't that big a deal. He just balled up socks... and a
melon...

I love this artichoke thing! Oh, don't tell me what's in it, the diet
starts tomorrow! (Laughs her Janice laugh)
You remember Janice.
(Startles them) There you are! Haaah, you got away from me!
(Imitating) But you found me!

Here, Ross, take our picture. (Hands him a camera and he starts
snapping) Smile! You're on Janice Camera!
Kill me. Kill me now.

(Ross is still taking their photo) Oh, I'm gonna blow this one up, and
I'm gonna write 'Reunited' in glitter.

Alright, Janice, that's it! Janice... Janice... Hey, Janice, when I
invited you to this party I didn't necessarily think that it meant that we-
Oh, no. Oh, no.
I'm sorry you misunderstood...
There y'go, kids.

(To a woman who he has clearly just met) And then the peacock bit me.
(Laughs) Please kiss me at midnight. (She leaves)
You seen Sandy?

Ooh. Uh, I don't know how to tell you this, but she's in Monica's
bedroom, getting it on with Max, that scientist geek. Ooh, look at that, I did know how to
tell you.
(on TV) In twenty seconds it'll be midnight...
And the moment of joy is upon us.
Perfect. Perfect. So now everybody's getting kissed but me.

Alright, somebody kiss me. Somebody kiss me, it's midnight! Somebody

Chandler, I gotta tell you, I love your mom's books! I love her books! I

Yeah, well, you wouldn't think it was cool if you're eleven years old
and all your friends are passing around page 79 of 'Mistress Bitch.'
C'mon, Chandler, I love your mom. I think she's a blast.
You can say that because she's not your mom.
Your mom was arrested?
Shhh, busy beaming with pride.

(on TV) ...This is kind of embarrassing, but occasionally after I've
